channel.title: Compiler error help!

item.title: Compiler error help!
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Project insanity uses a weird system for commands, so you’d wanna place it under the corresponding categories to your commands.

i.e;
The players command would go under the playersCommand void at the top of the class.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler error help!
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“iLL Scape, post:11, topic:448071”][quote author=Scape-JAVA link=topic=550964.msg4038013#msg4038013 date=1341355532]
Replace your old coords command with it.
[/quote]For future references where do i place commands in commands.java?[/quote]

Anywhere as long as it isn’t in another command. Make sure you add it where you want the corresponding player & their rights to use it, for example a ::mute command would go under ‘moderatorCommands’ and a ::home command would go under ‘playerCommands’

Read full topic

[/quote]
What? lol

OP here, why did you add it at the bottom of the class?
http://pastebin.com/2vJyHkhJ[/quote]This did not help at all???

src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:750: error: cannot find symbol
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“coords”)) {
^
symbol: variable command
location: class Commands

^
symbol: variable absX
location: class Commands
src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:751: error: cannot find symbol

^
symbol: variable absY
location: class Commands

item.title: Compiler error help!
item.dc:creator: @iLL_Scape iLL Scape
item.description:
@iLL_Scape wrote:

Ok so im trying to add the command ::coords and when i compile i get 2 errors this is what the command looks like if

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“coords”))
{
sendMessage(“X: “+absX+” Y: “+absY+””);
}

Now this is what the error looks like

src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:955: error: class, interface, or
enum expected
} if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“coords”))
^
src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:958: error: class, interface, or
enum expected
}
^
2 errors
Press any key to continue . . .
